## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$ip = "X.X.X.X"
Enter-PSSession -ComputerName $ip -Authentication Negotiate -ConfigurationName Minishell -Credential ~\EdgeUser -UseSSL
```

## Expected behavior

Connection established to a remote PSSession.

## Actual behavior

```none
Enter-PSSession: HTTPS on Unix does not currently support CA or CN checks. Use the PSSessionOption -SkipCACheck and -SkipCNCheck if you are certain you trust the server you are connecting to and the network in between.
```

## Environment data

```none
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.body: We could follow the message recommendations - Use the PSSessionOption -SkipCACheck and -SkipCNCheck if you are certain you trust the server you are connecting to and the network in between.

comments.author: blochl
comments.body:
> We could follow the message recommendations - Use the PSSessionOption -SkipCACheck and -SkipCNCheck if you are certain you trust the server you are connecting to and the network in between.

And what if I don't trust the server I am connecting to or the network in between? I guess the issue here is "HTTPS on Unix does not currently support CA or CN checks".

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body:
> And what if I don't trust the server I am connecting to or the network in between?

You cannot use the built in version included with PowerShell as the verification functionality was never implemented. You can look at using [PSWSMan](https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWSMan/) which is a fork of the WSMan library and included TLS verification that is missing from the built in version. Note that you still need to specify `-SessionOption (New-PSSessionOption -SkipCACeck -SkipCNCheck)` in PowerShell but rest assured cert validation still happens. When PowerShell 7.2 is out those session options aren’t mandatory anymore when you use this fork (they will actually disable the checks like on Windows) but older versions still require them to be set.
